result.execSummary:
The defendant Rachel Ann Slabey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rachel Ann Slabey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rachel Ann Slabey was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Report to probation no later than 6/9/22 at 4:00 PM.

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- AODA or other assessment determined by Agent and follow any recommended treatment.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent.
- Follow through with current treatment plan.

DE appeared. DE to pay $25/mo comm 8/1/22. $15 PPF added. DE signed PPA. jaf

10:59 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF:  Rachel Ann Slabey appeared. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Possess w/ Intent - Amphetamine. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Possess w/ Intent - Amphetamine. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 2-6. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 11:23 AM. kma

Court orders:
I/S Total: 10 years prison; 5 years I/C, 5 years E/S
3 years probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at least one time per month by Agent
- AODA or other assessment determined by Agent and follow any recommended treatment 
- Follow through with current treatment plan
- Maintain full-time employment or school
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court

Monthly payment plan approved, to commence 8/1/22.
Defendant to report to probation no later than today, 6/9/22 by 4:00 PM. 
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.     Clerk mailed to DE treatment facility. arc

ADDRESS INFO for Rachel Ann Slabey
Current: 153 N. Fourth Street, #3, New Richmond, WI 54017   (Effective: 02-07-2022)
Prior: 153 N. Fourth Street, #1, New Richmond, WI 54017
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Andre Doby or Joseph Nitchals.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
